node.statement: CAUCHY-SCHWARZ APPLICATION: Write Phi_n(r) = ||H_r||^2 where H_r = (H_r(lambda_1),...,H_r(lambda_n)) is a vector. Using the cumulant additivity from Step 1.5.2 and the expression for H_r in terms of cumulants, show that ||H_r||^2 can be bounded above by a function of ||H_p||^2 = Phi_n(p) and ||H_q||^2 = Phi_n(q) via the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality, establishing Phi_n(r) <= Phi_n(p)*Phi_n(q)/(Phi_n(p)+Phi_n(q)).
